meanings.definition: The body of peers or nobles in a country.
meanings.sent1: In the peerage, the nobles gather to discuss important matters.
meanings.sent2: The peerage includes dukes, earls, and barons.
meanings.sent3: At the royal ball, the peerage danced gracefully in their elegant attire.
meanings.sent4: She aspired to join the peerage, dreaming of a life of luxury and influence.
meanings.sent5: The peerage stood out in their regal attire, commanding respect from all.

meanings.definition: The rank or title of a peer.
meanings.sent1: His peerage granted him privileges and responsibilities.
meanings.sent2: The highest peerage in the land is that of the duke.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to have a peerage, demanding respect from friends.
meanings.sent4: She wore her peerage with pride, knowing the history and honor it represented.
meanings.sent5: The peerage symbolized generations of tradition and lineage, a mark of distinction.
